file_content.text: Look upon me, apprentice. You have never seen me so pleased.
And look around these chambers one last time. The humble trappings of yesterday.
With our dismantling of Darth Vengean complete, I assume his seat on the Dark Council and return to Korriban.
Well earned, master.
Congratulations.
This could not have been achieved without you.
It was my efforts that accomplished this.
Thanks to me.
The seeds were sewn long before your arrival, but I do acknowledge your essential role in the endgame.
Have our efforts propelled the Council toward full scale war?
And what of Plan Zero?
Indeed. Plan Zero and Vengean's doomed attempt to claim the fringe worlds have triggered war! The Treaty of Coruscant is no more!
We ascend together, apprentice. Only our combined strengths can propel us to the height of power.
Ah, the third side of this triumvirate arrives. Lord Draahg, welcome home.
It's been a long time, master. I'm ready to join the front line.
There is a war to win. What is your command, master?
Let's get started.
Together, we will be an unbeatable force.
Welcome.
Yes, all the pieces are in place now.
I won't need your help on the battlefield.
I work alone, Draahg.
Don't worry, I know you are at your best when given free range.
Now that I'm on the Dark Council, we are perfectly positioned to bring the Republic to its knees, to shape the galaxy as we wish.
Go and enjoy this victory, my apprentices. But be ready for my call. I will not sit idle long.
Go, apprentice. Release Lord Draahg and face Darth Vengean, before the opportunity is gone!
I'm back, master.
There is no time to waste, apprentice. Listen up.
Plan Zero was always my desire. I've been whispering in my master Darth Vengean's ear for years.
Inciting full scale war was but one goal. The other was the downfall of Darth Vengean so that I may ascend to his seat.
That is what I thought.
Of course.
Then we are in sync.
Making an enemy of a Dark Council member isn't the wisest thing.
Dangerous.
I have patiently waited and carefully set the stage.
I would have liked to have been included in the plan.
Why didn't you tell me?
You were instrumental, but I couldn't afford for you to know the details.
The council doesn't appreciate being undermined--they're all but calling for Vengean's head. A strike against him now would be met with universal support.
How would you like to face off against one of the twelve most powerful Sith in the galaxy?
I'm more than ready, master.
Just give the word.
And my reward?
As I move up, you move with me. And the rewards increase at every step.
Why don't you do it?
If Vengean dies at my minion's hand, the Dark Council will shudder at how powerful I must be.
There's another wrinkle. Darth Vengean's apprentice, Lord Draahg, has been secretly working for me--which Vengean discovered before I could recall him.
Vengean's rage is growing. You must free Draahg and face Darth Vengean together.
No time to waste.
Why should I bother saving my rival within your organization?
Let Draahg die.
I said nothing about Draahg being your rival. There's no need to fear him. In fact, he is rather in awe of you.
I can handle Vengean myself.
I don't need help.
I applaud your confidence, apprentice. But you will need Draahg to even forge access to Vengean.
Draahg knows Vengean's weaknesses and how to breach his inner sanctum. Administer this resuscitation drug to Draahg. It will restore his strength.
It will take both of you to overcome Vengean. So free the apprentice and destroy the master. Be off.
Apprentice, you are looking at a very pleased man.
Admiral Monk destroyed; the War Trust no more....
Now, with Jedi Xerender and Master Wyellett neutralized, all of the Republic's most vaunted leaders are no more. Plan Zero is complete.
I'm honored to have had a hand in it.
Duty is its own reward.
Your contribution will be rewarded far beyond the simple glory of it.
Where does it leave us, master?
What now?
Give credit where it's due.
It only matters that I know and acknowledge your accomplishments.
There is more to discuss--much of it of a sensitive nature, which I do not wish to convey via holo.
Return to my chambers here on Dromund Kaas. Immediately.
Apprentice, my master Darth Vengean is distraught. With his covert attack exposed, the Treaty of Coruscant has been broken.
And apparently, Moff Masken did not survive Admiral Monk's ambush. What happened?
He accused us of setting him up and then attacked me. So I killed him in self-defense.
He brought it on himself.
Ah, so he was twice the fool--first to falsely suspect us and then to believe he could defeat you.
It was the last mistake he'll ever make.
A fatal blunder.
Sadly, yes. Some people bring about their own destruction with little thought.
I feel terrible killing one of our own like that.
It's tragic.
That is often the price of power.
Masken accused us of setting him up. So I destroyed him.
I killed the Moff.
Did he really? Fascinating. While I appreciate you defending our good name, false accusations do little harm. Did you have to kill him?
Save the games, master. Admiral Monk confessed everything.
Come clean. I know the truth.
I see. So you know he was my minion and that I orchestrated the ambush and Darth Vengean's blunder.
The penalty for lying to me is death.
He's a liar.
Severe for something as commonplace as a lie. Still, I won't challenge your right to punish him.
I didn't like his tone. Or maybe it was his face. I don't recall.
It was whimsy.
Hopefully, the inspiration for your future actions will be less murky.
Admiral Monk must have killed him.
[Lie] I found him dead.
Is that so? How interesting. Well, at least you avenged him.
What's important is that you accomplished your objective--the elimination of Admiral Monk. It is a major blow to the Republic.
It seems to me there was more going on here than you led me to believe.
You tell me.
Figured it out, did you?
Yes, apprentice, Admiral Monk was my minion. And I orchestrated the ambush and Darth Vengean's blunder.
Don't let this newfound knowledge confuse you.
I'm sure there are reasons for your actions, and I don't need to know them.
It's none of my business.
You are the perfect disciple. You will be brought up to speed when the time is right.
What was the purpose of this?
Why did you do it?
Tell me you're not actually working for the Republic.
I hope you're not a traitor.
Hmm-mm-mm. That is most amusing. No, apprentice, I am most decidedly not with the Republic.
I understand your desire to know more, but I must keep this affair my own for now. All will become clear soon.
Now, the final Plan Zero target has been discovered. The hunt for Jedi Knight Xerender takes you to Hoth. Contact me when you arrive.
As you may recall, my master, Darth Vengean, set off to conquer the fringe systems and inspire the Dark Council to reignite the war.
Somehow, Admiral Monk caught wind of the plan and was waiting in ambush. He is laying siege to the flagship as we speak!
I'll stop the siege, master.
Send me.
That is an excellent idea.
The plan was secret. Do you think there's a leak?
How did Monk know?
Information is a funny thing. It trickles in unexpected ways. Leave those concerns to me.
Let your master iron out his own mess.
Not my problem.
My master is your master. His messes are our messes.
Plan Zero calls for Admiral Monk's head--this may be our only opportunity to crush him.
Our flagship is commanded by Moff Masken. Fly to the space battle immediately, board his ship and stop Admiral Monk's siege.
Apprentice, the War Trust's dismantling has been your finest hour, but a new challenge arises. One of our missing targets, Admiral Monk, has revealed himself.
Apprentice, your targets are the Republic's six most important military leaders.
There are two I must still locate--Admiral Monk who commands the Republic fleet, and Jedi Knight Xerender who leads an elite squad of commandos.
But the other targets--the four generals of the Republic's strategic command--are confirmed to be on the planet Taris. You must speed there immediately.
I will be there shortly, master.
Right away.
Tell me about this planet.
Taris, huh?
Taris was once controlled by the Empire. Years ago, while hunting a couple dangerous Jedi, a Sith Lord devastated it from above.
Though the planet has been a useless husk ever since, the Republic seems to have renewed interest in it.
I thought you said you were prepared, Baras.
So, you lost the other two?
They will be found soon enough, apprentice. You worry about Taris.
I will give you the particulars of your mission when you arrive. Baras out.
